core.app.window

Interface Windows

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ApplicationWindow, Dialog, MessageDialog, Window

    public interface Windows

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addConfirmationButtons(java.lang.String confirmButtonName, java.lang.String disconfirmButtonName)
      Adds both a ConfirmButton and a DisconfirmButton +to this Dialog with the given names
      void addConfirmButton(java.lang.String confirmButtonName)
      Adds a ConfirmButton to this Dialog with the given name
      void addDisconfirmButton(java.lang.String disconfirmButtonName)
      Adds a DisconfirmButton to this Dialog with the given name
      void close()
      Closes this Windows object
      void confirm()
      Override this method to process actions to confirm information presented in a window or dialog.
      void disconfirm()
      Override this method to process actions to disconfirm information presented in a window or dialog.
      ConfirmButton getConfirmButton()
      Returns the ConfirmButton used by this window.
      DisconfirmButton getDisconfirmButton()
      Returns the DisonfirmButton used by this window.
      Layouter getLayouter()
      Returns the Layouter used by this Windows object
      boolean isConfirmed()
      Indicates whether or not the user has confirmed information presented in this window or dialog.

      Sets the state indicating whether or not the user has confirmed information in this Windows object.

      Sets the focus on the given button.

      • addConfirmationButtons

        void addConfirmationButtons(java.lang.String confirmButtonName,
                            java.lang.String disconfirmButtonName)
        Adds both a ConfirmButton and a DisconfirmButton +to this Dialog with the given names

      • confirm

        void confirm()
        Override this method to process actions to confirm information presented in a window or dialog. For example, if a dialog gives the user the option of closing this Windows object, place the code closing the window in this method.

      • disconfirm

        void disconfirm()
        Override this method to process actions to disconfirm information presented in a window or dialog. For example, if a dialog gives the user the option of closing this Windows object, place the code closing the window in this method.

      • isConfirmed

        boolean isConfirmed()
        Indicates whether or not the user has confirmed information presented in this window or dialog.

      • isConfirmed

        void isConfirmed(boolean isConfirmed)
        Sets the state indicating whether or not the user has confirmed information in this Windows object.
        Parameters:
        isConfirmed - Indicates whether or not the user has confirmed information presented in this window or dialog. true if the user has confirmed and false if not.

      • getConfirmButton

        ConfirmButton getConfirmButton()
        Returns the ConfirmButton used by this window.

        the ConfirmButton used by this window
